column4: Can anyone tell me why i must use sudo su to echo -n 95 > /proc/acpi/video/GFX0/DD03/brightness
sudo does not work nor, sudo -s
your sending a setting to proc - basically direct HW access!  this is root's domain.
what are you trying to do!?!?  strange to be sending "-n 95" to a video card?!?!
but "-n 95" are you SURE that's the command!
look into copying with recursive feature enabled.  mv does this automatically but copy (cp) does not - if that's what command you're using.  good luck.
no its, simple backup suite, a gui for sbackup
it has a list of packages, but why not just copy the /usr/bin/files
sorry don't know anything about sbackup - though you'd written a simple script for backup and cp might have been giving you troubles.  hope someone else knows.
i might be writing one soon......
typically /usr/bin (and /usr/local/bin/ ) aren't high priorities for backup for me personally - i'm more interested in the packages then the binaries themselves.  best of luck.
will the packages run without the binaries !?
if you have a DEB for a program (that's something i personally backup)
backup the source code then the tar.gz file - keep that
and any config files from that program
see #ubuntu-server -- but ya - i run most of my server vm's in 8g
